definition: Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
to be good at understanding others (idiom)
turned out other than expected (idiom); unexpected
to exceed all expectations/to come as a surprise
goose feather sent from afar, a slight present but weighty meaning (idiom); It's not the present the counts, it's the thought behind it.
pinyin: qian1 li3 song4 e2 mao2 , li3 qing1 ren2 yi4 zhong4
containing_words.word: 千里送鵝毛，禮輕人意重

definition: slight present but weighty meaning (idiom); It's not the present the counts, it's the thought behind it.
goose feather sent from afar, a slight present but weighty meaning (idiom); It's not the present the counts, it's the thought behind it.
pinyin: li3 qing1 ren2 yi4 zhong4 , qian1 li3 song4 e2 mao2
containing_words.word: 禮輕人意重，千里送鵝毛

sentences.english: The academic society decompresses the life not impossible acme of perfection for oneself, all then people's desires.
sentences.chinese: 學會給自己解壓人生不可能盡善盡美，皆遂人意。

sentences.english: It can be easily used with freshing touch, non greasy, protect the skin with favorable moisturizing effect.
sentences.chinese: 雖爲乳霜，卻出人意料地易於塗抹，觸感清爽不油膩。

sentences.english: Over all, Egypt’s competitiveness is mediocre but not terrible.
sentences.chinese: 總體來說，埃及的競爭力差強人意，但也不算太糟。

sentences.english: With his head stuck on the ground, the poor man acknowledged her kindness and beckoned the woman to go away.
sentences.chinese: 乞丐善解人意地趴在地上擺了擺手，示意女人離開。

sentences.english: If results are not what we want, that is even a bigger motivation to fight.
sentences.chinese: 假如結果不如人意，那正是讓我更加鼓足幹勁的理由。

sentences.english: And yet, according to the MRI, my libido is surprisingly strong.
sentences.chinese: 然而，根據核磁共振成像，我的性驅力出人意料的強。

sentences.english: Dryden often surpasses expectation, and Pope never falls below it.
sentences.chinese: 德萊頓經常出人意料，而蒲柏從不令人失望。

sentences.english: The man's survival was surprising, as the doctors thought he would die.
sentences.chinese: 人能活真是出人意外，醫生們他必死。

sentences.english: But the comic surface turned out to mask unexpected depths.
sentences.chinese: 但是外表的喜劇色彩卻掩蓋了出人意料的內心深度。

sentences.english: Surprisingly, the black hole also catapults stars away.
sentences.chinese: 出人意料的是，黑洞也會彈射恆星。

sentences.english: Life is just a box of chocolates, Forrest. You never know what you are going to get .
sentences.chinese: 人生就像一盒巧克力，箇中滋味往往出人意料。

sentences.english: But there were unexpected findings too.
sentences.chinese: 但是，也有出人意料的發現。

sentences.english: The point is to realize that change can be great and that it can’t as well.
sentences.chinese: 關鍵是要意識到變化可能是好的也可能不盡如人意。

sentences.english: She was very touched by the thoughtfulness of her daughters.
sentences.chinese: 母親很感動女兒們的善體人意。

sentences.english: The only time you're likely to be happy is when everything is working out just right.
sentences.chinese: 你惟一的快樂時光便是一切都順順當當盡如人意。

sentences.english: I am a traditional Chinese lady, tender, virtuous, loving, enjoy life. Like travel, sports, nature, beastie.
sentences.chinese: 我是一位傳統的中國女性，溫柔賢惠，善解人意。

definition: things turn out contrary to the way one wishes (idiom)
as one wants/according to one's wishes/ruyi scepter, a symbol of power and good fortune
to fail/to fail to materialize/not to get one's way
